column1: #PFC CSV FILE
#This is a HEAT input file responsible for:
# 1) Defining the PFCs in the Region of Interest (ROI)
# 2) Defining the intersection PFCs that the ROI PFCs could be shadowed by
# 3) Defining the timesteps we run HEAT for
# 4) Defining which divertor each PFC is in
# 5) Defining any PFCs we want to exclude from the intersection calculation
#The first line in this file should always be:
#timesteps
#Each new row under this header line represents a new PFC in the ROI.
#Definitions of each column (comma separated variable) from this header line:
#  timesteps: timesteps we include the PFC in during the HEAT calculation
#  PFCname: name of the PFC we want to calculate heat loads on.  Name should
#           be taken directly from the part in the CAD STP file.
#  DivCode:  divertor code.  This can be: LO
#            Lower Outer
#            are how each PFC in the ROI get flagged as belonging to a specific
#            divertor
column2: and will affect their power later (Psol * powerFrac)

column1: #  intersectName:  name of the PFCs that may cast a magnetic shadow upon the PFC
#                  we are calculating power on.  If we launch field lines from the
#                  PFCname part and follow them up the SOL
column2: we may hit one of these

column1: #                  intersectName PFCs.  If the user is unsure of this value
#                  can be specified to check against all parts in the CAD.
#                  Multiple PFCs can be specified by using ":" between part names.
#  excludeName:  name of PFCs to exclude in the intersection check.  This can be
#                useful when we use the "all" switch for intersectName and want
#                to exclude some obvious PFCs.
#Example to calculate heat loads on PFC001
column2: a PFC in the Lower Outer divertor

column1: # for the first 100ms of the discharge
# with PFC001 (self)
# timesteps
#Example to calculate heat loads on PFC001
column2: a PFC in the Upper Inner divertor

column1: # for timesteps 100:200ms of the discharge
# with all PFCs in the CAD file:
# timesteps
timesteps
### OUTER DIVERTOR
### OUTER WALL (DIVERTED)
### OUTER WALL (ALL INTERSECTIONS)
### OUTER LIMITERS
### INNER DIVERTOR
### INNER WALL (ALL INTERSECTIONS)
### INNER LIMITERS
